body.p: In the 2019 Exposure Draft, the Board proposed a one-year deferral of the effective date to balance:

li.p: providing certainty about the effective date considering the uncertainty caused by the Board’s decision in October 2018 to explore possible amendments to IFRS 17 (see paragraphs BC6A–BC6C); and
requiring IFRS 17 implementation as soon as possible because:
IFRS 17 is a Standard urgently needed to address many inadequacies in previous accounting practices for insurance contracts; and
undue delay in the effective date of the Standard may increase workload and costs, particularly for entities that are advanced in their implementation projects.
